alert.note: Alert for Southeastern Brooks Range (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 24 at 5:30AM AKDT until March 24 at 6:00PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with low visibility expected. Total snow accumulations of two inches. South winds gusting to 40 mph. Visibility one half mile or less at times. * WHERE...In Passes of the Southeastern Brooks Range. * WHEN...Until 6 PM AKDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Snow drifts will form. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The windiest conditions and lowest visibility will be in passes. Snow and blowing snow will taper off this evening. Another round of snow and blowing snow with near blizzard conditions is possible Saturday night and Sunday.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
